body:
> Configuration property 'ROOT_LOGGER' was not used

hmm interesting? with my change or without my change? I have verified that my change fix the presto test.
@srkukarni what is the purpose of this change? how is that different from #3858 ?

@sijie Thanks for point out these. Is there any other better way to deal with this issue? Or we just need to update the doc [Configuring Brokers](https://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/deploy-bare-metal/#configuring-brokers) to guide users to match the service urls that provided when initializing the cluster's metadata? Any help would be appreciated!

@sijie just trying to figure out whats going on here. One theory was that programs were looking for PULSAR_ prefix for env vairables, so trying out something else.
I see however that both this and #3858 are suffering from the same failures.

rerun java8 tests
rerun integration tests
in the recent jenkins CI, presto is passing.
@codelipenghui can you review this PR also? since it is related to interceptors.
@murong00 I think updating the documentation is a better idea for this case.
@ambition119 it seems that you removed the support from generic record. are you going to handle it in a separate PR?

run cpp tests
run java8 tests

Yes, we should have a way to configure the explicit LAC update on the topics and have some reasonable default.

Though, should this be for 2.3.1? I think it would more be appropriate for 2.4 since it's not a bug.. but rather a current limitation.

run java8 tests
run integration tests

run java8 tests
run integration tests

One use case for this is during development, when the schema is still in a state of flux. Currently for every incompatible schema change a new topic has to be created (e.g. MyTopic_v1, MyTopic_v2, ...). This makes testing and releasing (with the desired production topic name) more difficult than it should be.
@sijie Thanks for the advice, please review this change.

run integration tests
run java8 tests

run java8 tests
run integration tests
Still there's a problem here. The Jersey JdkConnector only follows 307 redirect for GET requests..
@srkukarni this solves the source/sink update issue when running pulsar standalone?

run java8 tests
run integration tests

run integration tests
run java8 tests

run cpp tests
run java8 tests
should this feature be part of 2.4.0 or 2.3.1?
Kafka config parser has check to make sure 'max.poll.records' value is greater than 1 and will throw exception if config < 1, so I didn't add extra check.

run integration tests
run java8 tests

run java8 tests
run integration tests
Is there a workaround available for Pulsar 2.3.0, other than starting an entirely new topic which doesn't have soft-deleted schema's?
@merlimat I've made the rest apis into a drop down menus.
@fananchong seems like a connectivity issue. did you try again?

I try again, now this issue is pass. But have a new issue:
```shell
uf6e9i0ay01bn3ms3pdxz:~# go get -u github.com/apache/pulsar/pulsar-client-go/pulsar
# github.com/apache/pulsar/pulsar-client-go/pulsar
In file included from go/src/github.com/apache/pulsar/pulsar-client-go/pulsar/c_client.go:24:
./c_go_pulsar.h:22:10: fatal error: pulsar/c/client.h: No such file or directory
22 | #include <pulsar/c/client.h>
   |          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.
```
You need to install pulsar c++ client package. Go client is  a wrapper on top of c++ client https://pulsar.apache.org/docs/latest/clients/Cpp/
